questions.question_text: Once the make-or-buy analysis is completed, which document defines the project delivery method?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
It is correct: Once the make-or-buy analysis is complete and the decision is
made to acquire from outside the project, a procurement
strategy should be identified.
https://ln.run/p4sgr

Selected Answer: B
The answer is B

Selected Answer: B
The answer is B

Selected Answer: B
B is correct.

Once the make-or-buy analysis is completed, the document that defines the project delivery method is the "Procurement Strategy." The procurement strategy outlines how the project will obtain the necessary goods, services, or works. It includes decisions on whether to make in-house, buy from external sources, or use a combination of both approaches. The procurement strategy is a key component of the overall project management plan and helps guide the procurement activities throughout the project.

questions.question_text: Which set of competencies should a project manager have?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
B&D are the only two possible answers here. The rest are non-M&C process activities.

Selected Answer: BD
From Bing
B and D

The key benefit of this process is 
that it ensures that both the seller’s and buyer’s performance meet the project’s requirements according to the 
terms of the legal agreement.
pG492

why not a and b. The Control Procurements process helps ensure that contract performance meets the terms of the legal agreement (B) as it includes monitoring the vendor's performance and addressing any issues that arise. It also enables the development of make-or-buy decisions (A) by identifying the best approach for procuring goods and services. These two benefits help to mitigate risks, manage costs and maintain the quality of the project.

comments.content: Make or buy decisions are made DURING the planning process, not when you're controlling said procurements. If you're making the make or buy decision in the controlling procurement part of the project, you're way too late in the game.

choices.E: Helps determine whether a certain type of contract should be used
choices.D: Assures that legal agreements guide contract closings
choices.B: Ensures that contract performance meets the terms of the legal agreement
choices.C: Guarantees that legal agreements influence vendor selection
choices.A: Enables the development of make-or-buy decisions

questions.question_text: Select two key benefits of the Control Procurements process. (Choose two.)
A project it just beginning, and management creates a long list of potential stakeholders. Which statement about identifying and engaging stakeholders is correct?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B for sure
B-Stakeholder satisfaction

choices.A: The project manager should identify and deal with stakeholders only during the execution phase.
choices.D: Stakeholder satisfaction is the most important goal, and project objectives should be considered a secondary priority.
choices.B: Stakeholder satisfaction should be identified immediately and managed as a project objective.
choices.C: The project manager should focus on project objectives and deal with stakeholders as a secondary priority.
